body:
I don't think we should expose the special nodes directly. We might not always want to represent them this way.

Can we do `Value* entryWorld(); Value* exitWorld();` and `void setExitWorld(Value*)`. It would be a clearer API here.  

It would also be clearer for the world token value to always exist rather than have a condition of how many inputs or outputs to these nodes.
body_html:
I don't think we should expose the special nodes directly. We might not always want to represent them this way.

Can we do Value* entryWorld(); Value* exitWorld(); and void setExitWorld(Value*). It would be a clearer API here.

It would also be clearer for the world token value to always exist rather than have a condition of how many inputs or outputs to these nodes.
body_text:
I don't think we should expose the special nodes directly. We might not always want to represent them this way.
Can we do Value* entryWorld(); Value* exitWorld(); and void setExitWorld(Value*). It would be a clearer API here.
It would also be clearer for the world token value to always exist rather than have a condition of how many inputs or outputs to these nodes.
